Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.logmanager

Class ScreenWriterOutput

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.logmanager.ScreenWriterOutput
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ScreenWriterOutput extends Object implements Serializable
Utility class to dump a string to the screen and/or a BufferedWriter object and/or an internal StringBuffer. All 3 output destinations can be turned on or off collectively or independently which makes this a convenient object for dumping standard output in cases where all, some, or none of the output mechanisms is desirable.

In order to turn on output to the BufferedWriter a writer must first be set with a call to setWriter(BufferedWriter bw). If the BufferedWriter object has not been set the call to turn on output to the BufferedWriter will throw an IOException.

See Also:
Serialized Form

      public void writeln​(Object s)

      Parameters:

    • createWriter

      public static ScreenWriterOutput createWriter​(String fn, boolean scrn, boolean file) throws IOException
      Create a file base output writer for writing files
      Parameters:
      fn - The file path/name of the output writer file
      scrn - If true screen output is turned ON, otherwise it is OFF.
      file - If true file output is turned ON, otherwise it is OFF.
      Returns:
      The new ScreenWriterOutput object.
      Throws:
      IOException
